Hi! My name is Zi WANG, and I am a first-year graduate student working in the Learning and Intelligent Systems Group at CSAIL, MIT. My research interest is in machine learning and its applications to robotics and other related areas such as vision and speech. Back in my undergrad, I worked on some interesting topics on machine learning such as deep learning and topic modeling supervised by Prof. Fei Sha and Prof. Jun Zhu.

More about me

Publications

Undergraduate work at Tsinghua University and University of Southern California

  • Jianfei Chen, Jun Zhu, Zi Wang, Xun Zheng, and Bo Zhang. Scalable Inference for Logistic-Normal Topic Models.  Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS), Lake Tahoe, USA, 2013. (NIPS 2013) [pdf] [project page][poster (at NIPS13)][poster (at MLA13)]
